backend/main.mo: Main Motoko actor implementing access control, user approval, invite-only mode, user profiles, and match tracking for multiple game modes (Accepting Gifts, Straight Shot, APA Practice, Official APA Match) with CRUD operations and query endpoints.
feature_evidence.json: Empty feature evidence report JSON file with no features documented.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Comprehensive summaries of all frontend components, pages, and routing logic including authentication, game modes (APA Practice, Accepting Gifts, Straight Shot), match history, stats, and admin features.
frontend/docs/v48-modecard-resume-button: Documentation describing a UI-only change to ModeCard component that reorders buttons to show 'Start New Game' above 'Resume Game' without changing any underlying session or navigation logic.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind CSS configuration with custom CSS variables for light and dark theme color schemes including background, foreground, primary, secondary, muted, accent, destructive, border, and chart colors.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point with viewport meta tag, title describing the app as an APA-style pool practice scorekeeper, and script tag loading the React app from main.tsx.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root application component defining TanStack Router configuration with error boundaries for all routes, including home, game modes, match history, stats, admin approvals, and smoke check pages, wrapped with ThemeProvider and AuthGate.
frontend/src/components/accepting-gifts/: Table component displaying Accepting Gifts win/loss performance statistics grouped by starting ball count levels (2-7) with empty state handling.
frontend/src/components/apa/ApaBallButto: Reusable ball button component for APA scoring with four states (unscored, playerA, playerB, dead), hover colors based on active player, and locked state support preventing interaction.
frontend/src/components/apa/apaBallStyle: Provides utility functions for APA 9-Ball scoring including ball value calculation with one-away rule logic and rack total computation ensuring 10 points per rack.
frontend/src/components/apa/ApaRackScori: Interactive panel for scoring individual APA 8-ball racks, tracking ball states (scored by player A/B, dead, or unscored), managing innings flow, defensive shots, and detecting when a player reaches their target score.
frontend/src/components/apa/ApaResultsSu: Displays final match results for APA matches, showing winner, skill levels, points earned/needed, defensive shots, innings, PPI, and team match points for both players.
frontend/src/components/apa/MatchupAnaly: Dropdown menu component that lists unique opponent names from official APA matches and triggers matchup analysis when an opponent is selected.
Enhanced matchup analysis dropdown with toggle for including practice matches, filters matches by opponent name, and displays the MatchupAnalysisPanel when an opponent is selected.

Panel displaying head-to-head statistics against a specific opponent, aggregating both official and practice APA matches, showing win/loss records, PPI trends, and match history sorted chronologically.
frontend/src/components/apa/RealApaMatch: Form component for creating or editing official APA match records, capturing match date, opponent details, skill levels, scores, innings, defensive shots, and notes with validation for numeric fields and score targets.
frontend/src/components/apa/useApaInning: React hook managing innings counter and turn flow for APA 9-Ball matches, incrementing innings when the bottom player (lag loser) completes their turn.
frontend/src/components/auth/AuthGate.ts: Authentication gate component that handles login flow, checks invite-only mode access control, and displays appropriate loading/access-denied states.
frontend/src/components/auth/LoginButton: Login/logout button component that manages Internet Identity authentication and clears query cache on logout.
frontend/src/components/auth/ProfileSetu: Dialog component for creating and editing user profiles with name and APA skill level, including connection retry logic and validation.
frontend/src/components/history/MatchHis: Table component displaying match history with multi-select checkboxes, delete functionality, and navigation to match details including PPI/aPPI calculations.
frontend/src/components/layout/AppLayout: Main application layout with header navigation, authentication status, admin controls, stats access, and footer with branding.
frontend/src/components/matches/DeleteMa: A button component that opens a confirmation dialog to permanently delete a match, with navigation to history or custom callback on success.
frontend/src/components/matches/EndMatch: A reusable alert dialog component for confirming match termination with customizable title, description, and confirm text.
frontend/src/components/matches/MatchSum: Displays a clickable card summarizing a match with mode badge, date, and mode-specific details (APA scores, Straight Shot results, etc.).
frontend/src/components/navigation/ModeC: A card component for game mode selection that shows start/resume buttons based on in-progress session state.
frontend/src/components/players/ApaAggre: Renders line charts for APA performance metrics (PPI, aPPI, points, defensive shots) over time using unified timestamp-keyed data.
frontend/src/components/straight-shot/St: Displays a bar chart showing the frequency distribution of shot counts across Straight Shot sessions.
Renders a table summarizing Straight Shot performance by ball count, showing wins, losses, and first win date.
Shows a composed bar and line chart of shot counts over time with calculated average for Straight Shot sessions.
frontend/src/dev/straight-shot-spot-chec: QA checklist document for manually verifying Straight Shot functionality remains intact after code changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: React Query hook that creates and caches an authenticated or anonymous backend actor, invalidating dependent queries on identity changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useActorRetry.ts: Hook providing a retry mechanism that clears and refetches the actor query without requiring page refresh.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: React hook and provider for Internet Identity authentication on ICP, managing login state, identity persistence, and delegation validation with configurable AuthClient options.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: React Query hooks for CRUD operations on matches and user profiles, including approval status management and AG level index operations, all using the backend actor.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind CSS configuration with custom CSS variables for light and dark themes, defining colors for UI components like sidebar, cards, borders, and charts.
frontend/src/lib/accepting-gifts/accepti: Defines the 12-level Accepting Gifts progression system (2+8 through 7+9) with helpers for level management, clamping, and computing next baseline level based on win/loss outcomes.
Manages Accepting Gifts game session state including attempt tracking, scoring logic (player vs ghost in race-to-7 sets), and set progression without modifying baseline levels.
frontend/src/lib/apa/apaAggregateStats.t: Extracts and aggregates APA match statistics (PPI, aPPI, points, defensive shots) from both practice and official matches, with independent field validation and null handling for invalid data.
frontend/src/lib/apa/apaEqualizer.ts: Defines APA 9-Ball equalizer system mapping skill levels (1-9) to points-to-win targets (14-75 points) with validation and formatting utilities.
frontend/src/lib/apa/apaMatchPoints.ts: Implements APA 9-Ball match point conversion (20-point system) based on loser's skill level and points pocketed, with threshold tables for each skill level defining outcomes like '20-0' through '12-8'.
frontend/src/lib/apa/apaPracticeMatchOut: Computes APA Practice match outcomes by determining the winner based on target scores, then using the loser's skill level and points pocketed to calculate match points for both players.
frontend/src/lib/apa/apaScoring.ts: Defines APA 9-ball rack scoring logic with 10 points per rack, validates rack totals, and calculates PPI (points per inning) statistics for players across multiple racks.
frontend/src/lib/apa/apaSkillLevelPredic: Predicts APA skill levels (1-9) from PPI and aPPI averages using two sets of ranges: one for the Official APA Tab and another for the Detailed Player Stats page.
frontend/src/lib/apa/officialApaExpected: Provides the official APA Expected PPI lookup table organized by win percentage buckets (10-100%) and skill levels (SL2-SL7), with functions to bucket win percentages and retrieve expected PPI values.
Derives Official APA match outcomes (win/loss/unknown) by comparing player scores against their skill-level-based targets, with helpers to use saved didWin fields or derive outcomes from match data.
frontend/src/lib/apa/officialApaPpi.ts: Calculates Official APA PPI (score divided by effective innings) and aPPI (adjusted PPI using expected PPI table for wins), computing win percentage from the last 20 matches for context.
frontend/src/lib/history/matchHistoryRow: Builds narrative strings for the Match History table, formatting match results differently for Official APA, APA Practice, Straight Shots, and Accepting Gifts modes with W/L indicators.
frontend/src/lib/matches/effectiveMatchD: Determines the effective match date timestamp for sorting, preferring user-entered dates for Official APA matches and falling back to dateTime, with functions to parse date strings and format human-readable dates.
frontend/src/lib/matches/matchBuilders.t: Exports buildOfficialApaMatchLog function that creates official APA match records with derived win/loss outcomes based on skill levels and scores, plus re-exports other match builders from the original file.
frontend/src/lib/matches/matchBuildersOr: Contains builder functions for creating APA 9-ball practice matches, Accepting Gifts matches, and Straight Shot matches with full player stats, scoring, and outcome computation.
frontend/src/lib/session/inProgressSessi: Provides centralized helpers for managing per-mode in-progress session state in sessionStorage with functions to get, set, clear, and check sessions for APA Practice, Accepting Gifts, and Straight Shot modes.
frontend/src/lib/stats/acceptingGiftsPer: Computes Accepting Gifts performance statistics grouped by starting ball count (2-7), tracking wins and losses from completed race-to-7 sets.
frontend/src/lib/stats/acceptingGiftsSta: Computes summary statistics for Accepting Gifts mode including total sessions and rolling average of ending object ball counts from the last N sessions.
Computes official APA match statistics including win rate, average PPI (last 10 matches), and average aPPI (best 10 of last 20), sorted chronologically by effective match timestamp.
frontend/src/lib/stats/straightShotStats: Computes comprehensive Straight Shot statistics including rolling/lifetime averages, lowest shot count, trend data, histogram data, and win/loss summary by ball count.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that sets up React root with QueryClient and InternetIdentityProvider wrappers around the main App component.
frontend/src/pages/accepting-gifts/Accep: Main game page for the Accepting Gifts drill, managing game state (levels, scores, attempts), handling rack attempts, set completion, and saving matches with retry logic for network issues.
Displays the rules and instructions for the Accepting Gifts drill, explaining the 12-level progression system, match format (race to 7), and advancement/demotion rules.
Start page for Accepting Gifts drill where users select their starting level, view rules, and begin a new session or resume an in-progress one with confirmation dialogs.
Live scoring page for APA 9-ball practice matches, managing rack-by-rack scoring, innings, defensive shots, and handling match completion with session persistence.
frontend/src/pages/apa/PracticeStartPage: Setup page for APA practice matches where users enter player names, skill levels, perform lag selection, and start or resume a match session.
frontend/src/pages/apa/RealApaMatchEditP: Edit page for official APA match logs, loading existing match data by ID and rendering the form with pre-populated values for updating.
frontend/src/pages/apa/RealApaMatchPlace: Entry page for logging official APA matches after the fact (not live scoring), rendering the match form in create mode.
frontend/src/pages/auth/AccessNotAllowed: Displays an access-denied page for invite-only apps, allowing users to request approval from the owner with success/error handling.
frontend/src/pages/history/MatchDetailsP: Shows detailed information for a single match including player stats, mode-specific details (APA/Gifts/Straight), and provides edit/delete actions with navigation to player aggregates.
frontend/src/pages/history/MatchHistoryP: Displays all matches in sortable table or card view, with tabs to filter by match type (All/APA/Gifts/Straight) and navigation back to home or stats.
frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx: Renders the main landing page with four mode cards (Official APA Match Log, APA Practice, Accepting Gifts, Straight Shot) and a link to match history for authenticated users.
frontend/src/pages/owner/OwnerApprovalsP: Admin-only page for managing user access approvals, toggling invite-only mode, and viewing/approving/rejecting pending user requests.
frontend/src/pages/players/PlayerAggrega: Displays aggregate APA statistics for a specific player including best-10-of-20 PPI/aPPI averages, predicted skill levels, win rates, and matchup analysis from official matches only.
frontend/src/pages/SmokeCheckPage.tsx: Deployment verification page with a checklist and navigation buttons to test routing to Home and Match History pages.
frontend/src/pages/stats/StatsPage.tsx: Main statistics dashboard showing tabbed views of APA, Straight Shot, and Accepting Gifts performance metrics with charts, histograms, and opponent matchup analysis.
frontend/src/pages/straight-shot/Straigh: Main game page for the Straight Shot drill that manages game state (player name, notes, total shots), handles session persistence via sessionStorage, and provides UI for recording shots and ending the session with backend save functionality.
Displays the rules for the Straight Shot drill in a card component, explaining the objective (clear all balls in 20 shots or fewer), gameplay instructions, and winning criteria.

Start page for Straight Shot drill that displays player stats (moving average of last 10 sessions), allows starting new sessions or resuming in-progress sessions, and shows confirmation dialog when overwriting existing sessions.
frontend/src/utils/errorText.ts: Utility function that extracts readable error messages from various error types (strings, Error objects, nested objects) with fallback to generic error messages.
frontend/src/utils/playerName.ts: Provides utility functions for normalizing player names (trim and lowercase) and comparing player names case-insensitively for consistent matching.
frontend/src/utils/playerRoutes.ts: Builds URL-encoded route paths for player aggregate stats pages given a player name.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Comprehensive URL parameter utilities for extracting parameters from query strings and hash-based routing, with sessionStorage persistence support and parameter cleanup functions.
frontend/src/utils/withTimeout.ts: Wraps a Promise with a timeout that rejects if the promise doesn't resolve within the specified time limit.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration with custom theme extensions including OKLCH color system, container settings, custom animations, and plugins for typography, container queries, and animations.
project_state.json: Project metadata tracking known issues with live scoring not updating when balls are selected, and pending feature requests to fix the ApaRackScoringPanel score update logic.
